belief_statement: BR
BR+
Engaging in physical activity is something I do automatically
I engage in physical activity compulsively
I have a physical activity routine I follow
I know when and where I will engage in physical activity over the next week
I monitor intensity and or duration of physical activity to make sure I do enough
I pace my physical activity to match my physical ability
When weather is bad, I engage in physical activity indoors
BR-
I monitor the intensity and duration of physical activity to make sure I do not overdo it
BaCap
BaCap+
I am confident in my ability to engage in physical activity
BaCap-
I lack confidence in engaging in physical activity because of my heart condition
Illnesses other than heart failure limit my ability to engage in physical activity
My limitations to engaging in physical activity is part of getting older
Symptoms of my heart failure (e.g. breathlessness; tight chest; fatigue; swollen legs) limit my ability to engage in physical activity
BaCon
BaCon+
I engage in physical activity because it makes me feel more cheerful
Physical activity improves my general health
Physical activity improves the condition of my heart
BaCon-
Physical activity Is dangerous because it puts my heart under strain
Physical activity brings on my symptoms (ie., fatigue)
Physical activity brings on my symptoms (ie., heavy legs and arms)
Physical activity brings on my symptoms (ie., tight chest)
Physical activity brings on my symtoms (e. g. breathlessness)
Physical activity does not bring any benefits for me
ECR
ECR+
Equipment (bike; treadmill) helps me in being active
Fascilities (eg., local council) help me in being physically active
Group programmes help me in being physically active
Having an implantable device reassures me when engaging in physical activity
My heart failure treatment (ie., medication) helps me in engaging in physical activity
My local environment is a useful resource for my physical activity engagement
My physical activity levels Increased since a major life event
My physical activity levels increased since health-related event
ECR-
My heart failure treatment (ie., medication) prevents me from engaging in physical activity
My implantable device can harm me if I engage in physical activity
My local environment limits me in engaging in physical activity (incline (hills); crowds; traffic; pollution)
My physical activity levels decreased since a major life event
My physical activity levels decreased since health-related event
Emotion
Emotion+
Emotion-
I am too worried about the consequences of being active
I have to be in a mood to exercise
I only engage in physical activity when I am bored
Low mood prevents me from engaging in physical activity
Goals
Goals+
Engaging in physical activity is a priority for me
I engage in physical activity to be able to get on with life without help from others
Goals-
Engaging in physical activity is not a priority for me
I already engage in as much physical activity as I am able to
I have integrated an adequate amount of physical activity into my life
Intention
Intention+
I try to engage in some form of physical activity every week
Intention-
I do not intend to be active for the sake of being active
Knowledge
Knowledge+
I know how much physical activity I can safely do
Knowledge-
I don't know whether physical activity is safe for me
MADP
MADP+
I do not normally forget about my scheduled exercise (eg., class, group activities, gym)
MADP-
Engaging in physical activity requires a lot of thought and planning
I am vigilant to my heart rate and chest sensations when I am exercising
I sometimes forget to follow my physical activity routine
Optimism
Optimism+
I am optimistic about my ability to engage in physical activity
I am optimistic by nature
I am optimistic that I will engage in physical activity in the near future
I hope to remain physically active
Optimism-
I am fairly pessimistic about my ability to engage in physical activity in the future
Reinforcement
Reinforcement+
I engage in physical activity because my doctor or other health professionals are pleased with me when I do
I engage in physical activity because people close to me are pleased with me when I do
I enjoy engaging in physical activity
I exercise because I feel much better when I have done so
I feel pleased with myself when I have engaged in some physical activity
Reinforcement-
Negative consequences of PA (pain; getting out f breath) discourage me
Physical activity is not an enjoyment, it is an obligation
SI
SI+
I am physically active because everyone I know closely is physically active
I engage in physical activity because a health professional (e.g. GP, consultant, nurse, physiotherapist) has advised me to do so
I know others my age who do not engage in physical activity much and their health detoriated
I rely on other people to perform physical activity
I would engage in physical activity if it involved being with others
I would exercise with others if their level matched my capability
Making plans with others encourage me to engage in physical activity
People who are important to me encourage me to be physically active
having a reassurance from a health professional that PA is safeencourage me to exercise
SI-
I limit my physical activity because a health professional (e.g. GP, consultant, nurse, physiotherapist) has advised me to not overdo it
People who are important to me discourage me from engaging in physical activity
SPR
SPR+
Being physically active is a big part of my life
I have always been an active person
SPR-
I am not a particularly active person
I am not an athletic person
Skills
Skills+
Being shown how to perform a form of physical activity helped me to become more physically active
Skills-
After I have been hospitalised, I had to get used to walking again (I had to learn)
I require training to be able to perform physical activity
Total
